description: Returns information about an AutoML job created by calling CreateAutoMLJob.

parameters.name: AutoMLJobName
parameters.description: Requests information about an AutoML job using its unique name.

nested_items.name: AutoMLJobName
nested_items.description: Returns the name of the AutoML job.

nested_items.name: AutoMLJobArn
nested_items.description: Returns the ARN of the AutoML job.

nested_items.name: InputDataConfig
nested_items.description: Returns the input data configuration for the AutoML job.

nested_items.name: DataSource
nested_items.description: The data source for an AutoML channel.

nested_items.name: S3DataSource
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location of the input data.

nested_items.name: S3DataType
nested_items.description: The data type.

If you choose S3Prefix, S3Uri identifies a key name prefix. SageMaker AI uses all objects that match the specified key name prefix for model training. The S3Prefix should have the following format: s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET/DOC-EXAMPLE-FOLDER-OR-FILE.

If you choose ManifestFile, S3Uri identifies an object that is a manifest file containing a list of object keys that you want SageMaker AI to use for model training. A ManifestFile should have the format shown below: [ {"prefix": "s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET/DOC-EXAMPLE-FOLDER/DOC-EXAMPLE-PREFIX/"}, "DOC-EXAMPLE-RELATIVE-PATH/DOC-EXAMPLE-FOLDER/DATA-1", "DOC-EXAMPLE-RELATIVE-PATH/DOC-EXAMPLE-FOLDER/DATA-2", ... "DOC-EXAMPLE-RELATIVE-PATH/DOC-EXAMPLE-FOLDER/DATA-N" ]

nested_items.type: for example, for jobs created by calling CreateAutoMLJobV2
nested_items.description: If you choose AugmentedManifestFile, S3Uri identifies an object that is an augmented manifest file in JSON lines format. This file contains the data you want to use for model training. AugmentedManifestFile is available for V2 API jobs only (for example, for jobs created by calling CreateAutoMLJobV2). Here is a minimal, single-record example of an AugmentedManifestFile: {"source-ref": "s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET/DOC-EXAMPLE-FOLDER/cats/cat.jpg", "label-metadata": {"class-name": "cat" } For more information on AugmentedManifestFile, see Provide Dataset Metadata to Training Jobs with an Augmented Manifest File.

nested_items.name: S3Uri
nested_items.description: The URL to the Amazon S3 data source. The Uri refers to the Amazon S3 prefix or ManifestFile depending on the data type.

nested_items.name: CompressionType
nested_items.description: You can use Gzip or None. The default value is None.

nested_items.name: TargetAttributeName
nested_items.description: The name of the target variable in supervised learning, usually represented by --y'.

nested_items.name: ContentType
nested_items.description: The content type of the data from the input source. You can use text/csv;header=present or x-application/vnd.amazon+parquet. The default value is text/csv;header=present.

nested_items.name: ChannelType
nested_items.description: The channel type (optional) is an enum string. The default value is training. Channels for training and validation must share the same ContentType and TargetAttributeName. For information on specifying training and validation channel types, see How to specify training and validation datasets.

nested_items.name: SampleWeightAttributeName
nested_items.description: If specified, this column name indicates which column of the dataset should be treated as sample weights for use by the objective metric during the training, evaluation, and the selection of the best model. This column is not considered as a predictive feature. For more information on Autopilot metrics, see Metrics and validation.

nested_items.name: OutputDataConfig
nested_items.description: Returns the job's output data config.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Key Management Service encryption key ID.

nested_items.name: S3OutputPath
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 output path. Must be 512 characters or less.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that has read permission to the input data location and write permission to the output data location in Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: AutoMLJobObjective
nested_items.description: Returns the job's objective.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the objective metric used to measure the predictive quality of a machine learning system. During training, the model's parameters are updated iteratively to optimize its performance based on the feedback provided by the objective metric when evaluating the model on the validation dataset.
For tabular problem types:
List of available metrics:
Regression: MAE, MSE, R2, RMSE.
Binary classification: Accuracy, AUC, BalancedAccuracy, F1, Precision, Recall.
Multiclass classification: Accuracy, BalancedAccuracy, F1macro, PrecisionMacro, RecallMacro.
For image or text classification problem types:
List of available metrics: Accuracy For a description of each metric, see Autopilot metrics for text and image classification.
Default objective metrics: Accuracy.
For time-series forecasting problem types:
List of available metrics: RMSE, wQL, Average wQL, MASE, MAPE, WAPE For a description of each metric, see Autopilot metrics for time-series forecasting.
Default objective metrics: AverageWeightedQuantileLoss.

For text generation problem types (LLMs fine-tuning): Fine-tuning language models in Autopilot does not require setting the AutoMLJobObjective field. Autopilot fine-tunes LLMs without requiring multiple candidates to be trained and evaluated. Instead, using your dataset, Autopilot directly fine-tunes your target model to enhance a default objective metric, the cross-entropy loss. After fine-tuning a language model, you can evaluate the quality of its generated text using different metrics. For a list of the available metrics, see Metrics for fine-tuning LLMs in Autopilot.

nested_items.name: ProblemType
nested_items.description: Returns the job's problem type.

nested_items.name: AutoMLJobConfig
nested_items.description: Returns the configuration for the AutoML job.

nested_items.name: CompletionCriteria
nested_items.description: How long an AutoML job is allowed to run, or how many candidates a job is allowed to generate.

nested_items.name: MaxCandidates
nested_items.description: The maximum number of times a training job is allowed to run.

nested_items.name: MaxRuntimePerTrainingJobInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum time, in seconds, that each training job executed inside hyperparameter tuning is allowed to run as part of a hyperparameter tuning job. For more information, see the StoppingCondition used by the CreateHyperParameterTuningJob action.

nested_items.name: MaxAutoMLJobRuntimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum runtime, in seconds, an AutoML job has to complete.

nested_items.name: SecurityConfig
nested_items.description: The security configuration for traffic encryption or Amazon VPC settings.

nested_items.name: VolumeKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The key used to encrypt stored data.

nested_items.name: EnableInterContainerTrafficEncryption
nested_items.description: Whether to use traffic encryption between the container layers.

nested_items.name: VpcConfig
nested_items.description: The VPC configuration.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The VPC security group IDs, in the form sg-xxxxxxxx. Specify the security groups for the VPC that is specified in the Subnets field.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Subnets
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnets in the VPC to which you want to connect your training job or model. For information about the availability of specific instance types, see Supported Instance Types and Availability Zones.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CandidateGenerationConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for generating a candidate for an AutoML job (optional).

nested_items.name: FeatureSpecificationS3Uri
nested_items.description: A URL to the Amazon S3 data source containing selected features from the input data source to run an Autopilot job. You can input FeatureAttributeNames (optional) in JSON format as shown below:

nested_items.name: AlgorithmsConfig
nested_items.description: Stores the configuration information for the selection of algorithms trained on tabular data.
AlgorithmsConfig should not be set if the training mode is set on AUTO.

When AlgorithmsConfig is provided, one AutoMLAlgorithms attribute must be set and one only. If the list of algorithms provided as values for AutoMLAlgorithms is empty, CandidateGenerationConfig uses the full set of algorithms for the given training mode.
When AlgorithmsConfig is not provided, CandidateGenerationConfig uses the full set of algorithms for the given training mode.

nested_items.name: DataSplitConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for splitting the input training dataset.

nested_items.name: ValidationFraction
nested_items.description: The validation fraction (optional) is a float that specifies the portion of the training dataset to be used for validation. The default value is 0.2, and values must be greater than 0 and less than 1. We recommend setting this value to be less than 0.5.

nested_items.name: Mode
nested_items.description: The method that Autopilot uses to train the data. You can either specify the mode manually or let Autopilot choose for you based on the dataset size by selecting AUTO. In AUTO mode, Autopilot chooses ENSEMBLING for datasets smaller than 100 MB, and HYPERPARAMETER_TUNING for larger ones.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: Returns the creation time of the AutoML job.

nested_items.name: EndTime
nested_items.description: Returns the end time of the AutoML job.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: Returns the job's last modified time.

nested_items.name: FailureReason
nested_items.description: Returns the failure reason for an AutoML job, when applicable.

nested_items.name: PartialFailureReasons
nested_items.description: Returns a list of reasons for partial failures within an AutoML job.

nested_items.name: PartialFailureMessage
nested_items.description: The message containing the reason for a partial failure of an AutoML job.

nested_items.name: BestCandidate
nested_items.description: The best model candidate selected by SageMaker AI Autopilot using both the best objective metric and lowest InferenceLatency for an experiment.

nested_items.name: CandidateName
nested_items.description: The name of the candidate.

nested_items.name: FinalAutoMLJobObjectiveMetric
nested_items.description: The best candidate result from an AutoML training job.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of metric with the best result.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the metric with the best result. For a description of the possible objective metrics, see AutoMLJobObjective$MetricName.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the metric with the best result.

nested_items.name: StandardMetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the standard metric. For a description of the standard metrics, see Autopilot candidate metrics.

nested_items.name: ObjectiveStatus
nested_items.description: The objective's status.

nested_items.name: CandidateSteps
nested_items.description: Information about the candidate's steps.

nested_items.name: CandidateStepType
nested_items.description: Whether the candidate is at the transform, training, or processing step.

nested_items.name: CandidateStepArn
nested_items.description: The ARN for the candidate's step.

nested_items.name: CandidateStepName
nested_items.description: The name for the candidate's step.

nested_items.name: CandidateStatus
nested_items.description: The candidate's status.

nested_items.name: InferenceContainers
nested_items.description: Information about the recommended inference container definitions.

nested_items.name: Image
nested_items.description: The Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR) path of the container. For more information, see ContainerDefinition.

nested_items.name: ModelDataUrl
nested_items.description: The location of the model artifacts. For more information, see ContainerDefinition.

nested_items.name: Environment
nested_items.description: The environment variables to set in the container. For more information, see ContainerDefinition.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The creation time.

nested_items.name: EndTime
nested_items.description: The end time.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: The last modified time.

nested_items.name: FailureReason
nested_items.description: The failure reason.

nested_items.name: CandidateProperties
nested_items.description: The properties of an AutoML candidate job.

nested_items.name: CandidateArtifactLocations
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 prefix to the artifacts generated for an AutoML candidate.

nested_items.name: Explainability
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 prefix to the explainability artifacts generated for the AutoML candidate.

nested_items.name: ModelInsights
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 prefix to the model insight artifacts generated for the AutoML candidate.

nested_items.name: BacktestResults
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 prefix to the accuracy metrics and the inference results observed over the testing window. Available only for the time-series forecasting problem type.

nested_items.name: CandidateMetrics
nested_items.description: Information about the candidate metrics for an AutoML job.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the metric.

nested_items.name: StandardMetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the standard metric.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the metric.

nested_items.name: Set
nested_items.description: The dataset split from which the AutoML job produced the metric.

nested_items.name: InferenceContainerDefinitions
nested_items.description: The mapping of all supported processing unit (CPU, GPU, etc--¦) to inference container definitions for the candidate. This field is populated for the AutoML jobs V2 (for example, for jobs created by calling CreateAutoMLJobV2) related to image or text classification problem types only.

nested_items.name: Image
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: Image
nested_items.description: (list) ---

nested_items.name: Image
nested_items.description: The Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR) path of the container. For more information, see ContainerDefinition.

nested_items.name: ModelDataUrl
nested_items.description: The location of the model artifacts. For more information, see ContainerDefinition.

nested_items.name: Environment
nested_items.description: The environment variables to set in the container. For more information, see ContainerDefinition.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AutoMLJobStatus
nested_items.description: Returns the status of the AutoML job.

nested_items.name: AutoMLJobSecondaryStatus
nested_items.description: Returns the secondary status of the AutoML job.

nested_items.name: GenerateCandidateDefinitionsOnly
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the output for an AutoML job generates candidate definitions only.

nested_items.name: AutoMLJobArtifacts
nested_items.description: Returns information on the job's artifacts found in AutoMLJobArtifacts.

nested_items.name: CandidateDefinitionNotebookLocation
nested_items.description: The URL of the notebook location.

nested_items.name: DataExplorationNotebookLocation
nested_items.description: The URL of the notebook location.

nested_items.name: ResolvedAttributes
nested_items.description: Contains ProblemType, AutoMLJobObjective, and CompletionCriteria. If you do not provide these values, they are inferred.

nested_items.name: AutoMLJobObjective
nested_items.description: Specifies a metric to minimize or maximize as the objective of an AutoML job.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the objective metric used to measure the predictive quality of a machine learning system. During training, the model's parameters are updated iteratively to optimize its performance based on the feedback provided by the objective metric when evaluating the model on the validation dataset.
For tabular problem types:
List of available metrics:
Regression: MAE, MSE, R2, RMSE.
Binary classification: Accuracy, AUC, BalancedAccuracy, F1, Precision, Recall.
Multiclass classification: Accuracy, BalancedAccuracy, F1macro, PrecisionMacro, RecallMacro.
For image or text classification problem types:
List of available metrics: Accuracy For a description of each metric, see Autopilot metrics for text and image classification.
Default objective metrics: Accuracy.
For time-series forecasting problem types:
List of available metrics: RMSE, wQL, Average wQL, MASE, MAPE, WAPE For a description of each metric, see Autopilot metrics for time-series forecasting.
Default objective metrics: AverageWeightedQuantileLoss.

For text generation problem types (LLMs fine-tuning): Fine-tuning language models in Autopilot does not require setting the AutoMLJobObjective field. Autopilot fine-tunes LLMs without requiring multiple candidates to be trained and evaluated. Instead, using your dataset, Autopilot directly fine-tunes your target model to enhance a default objective metric, the cross-entropy loss. After fine-tuning a language model, you can evaluate the quality of its generated text using different metrics. For a list of the available metrics, see Metrics for fine-tuning LLMs in Autopilot.

nested_items.name: ProblemType
nested_items.description: The problem type.

nested_items.name: CompletionCriteria
nested_items.description: How long a job is allowed to run, or how many candidates a job is allowed to generate.

nested_items.name: MaxCandidates
nested_items.description: The maximum number of times a training job is allowed to run.

nested_items.name: MaxRuntimePerTrainingJobInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum time, in seconds, that each training job executed inside hyperparameter tuning is allowed to run as part of a hyperparameter tuning job. For more information, see the StoppingCondition used by the CreateHyperParameterTuningJob action.

nested_items.name: MaxAutoMLJobRuntimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum runtime, in seconds, an AutoML job has to complete.

nested_items.name: ModelDeployConfig
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the model was deployed automatically to an endpoint and the name of that endpoint if deployed automatically.

nested_items.name: AutoGenerateEndpointName
nested_items.description: Set to True to automatically generate an endpoint name for a one-click Autopilot model deployment; set to False otherwise. The default value is False.

nested_items.name: EndpointName
nested_items.description: Specifies the endpoint name to use for a one-click Autopilot model deployment if the endpoint name is not generated automatically.

nested_items.name: ModelDeployResult
nested_items.description: Provides information about endpoint for the model deployment.

nested_items.name: EndpointName
nested_items.description: The name of the endpoint to which the model has been deployed.
